Been playing around with photomicroscopy. No comments necessary - just thought I'd share. I consider the diversity of life to be a source of unending wonderment. Perhaps it's the kid in me. I'll try and post a few others as time permits. 
 
 Zea Mays stem c.s.
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/MicroC017.jpg
 
 Radiolaria
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/MicroC006.jpg
 
 Monocot flower bud c.s.
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/MicroC005.jpg
 
 Monocot flower bub c.s.
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/MicroC002.jpg
 
 Dicot flower bulb c.s.
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/MicroC003.jpg
How's this relate to religion, for you?
Very cool Orion. I really like the last one especially. How'd you get into this?

Just bumping the thread up a little.
 
 How did you get into this Orion?

Just bumping the thread up a little.
 
 How did you get into this Orion?

 
 I've for many years been interested in nature photography. This goes waay back before the advent of the digital camera. In fact, in 1985, I converted one of my bedrooms into a darkroom which I seldom use anymore. 
 
 A couple of additional examples...
 
 Fossil Nautilus (appx. 12 MYO)
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/nautpx5.jpg
 
 Sandstone
 
 http://i23.photobucket.com/albums/b360/Orion_9/sandstone.jpg
Those are great. I really like the sandstone one. Why don't you use your darkroom much anymore? Just less convenient than digital photography?
